intro: Adenanthos intricatus, commonly known as the mountain devil, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually small and opposite, with a rough texture that helps reduce water loss. Adenanthos intricatus is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in well-drained soils with full sun exposure.
